question: Should wealthy nations be required to share their wealth with poorer nations by providing them with things such as food and education? Or is this the responsibility of the governments of poorer nations to look after their citizens?
text: It is an exciting development that most of the developed and stable nations tend to support  third world countries in an extensive manner. Accordingly, a country can provide a helping hand by availing survival support such as food and accommodation, as well as, establishing medical and educational assistance. In this essay,we will be elaborating this viewpoint.

To embark upon, to ensure safety and security, wealthy nations can provide grants to  helpless countries. This enhances the standard of living of the citizens who are resided in the poor nation and the bond among both the parties will be stronger. Moreover, the supply of nutritious food for their consumption could ensure the individuals located in the underdeveloped location to be free from chronic disease and malnutrition. For example, recent news articles have stated that  most of the poorer nations have recorded a low rate of violence and crime as the grants from wealthy nations have backed up them to fulfil their needs and wants.

Furthermore, rich nations exercise their backing in the field of education and medical fields of a developing country. This approach ensures a nation to have their scholars and skilled workforce to have  extensive exposure towards the latest evolution in their respective fields. Similarly, it multitudes the chance of exploiting talent and creativity of the citizens. For instance, countries like the United States have recently established a committee to ensure the transmission of the latest scientific improvement among the poor nations which further helps the states to exploit and take advantage of this opportunity.

Inconclusion, rich nations generally provides various backing to their allied poorer countries to ensure their dominance among the powerful nations as well as to contribute towards  holistic improvement. Of the nations which are in need.
